spec.description: DiscoveredClusterSpec defines the desired state of DiscoveredCluster

activityTimestamp.description: ActivityTimestamp records the last observed activity of the cluster.

apiUrl.description: APIURL is the endpoint used to access the cluster's API server.

cloudProvider.description: CloudProvider specifies the cloud provider where the cluster is hosted (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).

console.description: Console provides the URL of the cluster's web-based console.

creationTimestamp.description: CreationTimestamp marks when the cluster was initially discovered.

credential.description: Credential references the Kubernetes secret containing authentication details for the cluster.

fieldPath.description:
If referring to a piece of an object instead of an entire object, this string
should contain a valid JSON/Go field access statement, such as desiredState.manifest.containers[2].
For example, if the object reference is to a container within a pod, this would take on a value like:
"spec.containers{name}" (where "name" refers to the name of the container that triggered
the event) or if no container name is specified "spec.containers[2]" (container with
index 2 in this pod). This syntax is chosen only to have some well-defined way of
referencing a part of an object.

kind.description:
Kind of the referent.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

name.description:
Name of the referent.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

namespace.description:
Namespace of the referent.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/namespaces/

resourceVersion.description:
Specific resourceVersion to which this reference is made, if any.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

uid.description:
UID of the referent.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#uids

displayName.description: DisplayName is a human-readable name assigned to the cluster.

importAsManagedCluster.description: ImportAsManagedCluster determines whether the discovered cluster should be automatically imported as a managed cluster.

isManagedCluster.description: IsManagedCluster indicates whether the cluster is currently managed.

name.description: Name represents the unique identifier of the discovered cluster.

ocpClusterId.description: OCPClusterID contains the unique identifier assigned by OpenShift to the cluster.

openshiftVersion.description: OpenshiftVersion specifies the OpenShift version running on the cluster.

owner.description: Owner identifies the owner or organization responsible for the cluster.

region.description: Region specifies the geographical region where the cluster is deployed.

rhocmClusterId.description: RHOCMClusterID contains the cluster ID from Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Manager.

status.description: Status represents the current state of the discovered cluster (e.g Active, Stale).

type.description: Type defines the type of cluster, such as OpenShift, Kubernetes, or a specific managed service type.

status.description: DiscoveredClusterStatus defines the observed state of DiscoveredCluster

conditions.description:
INSERT ADDITIONAL STATUS FIELD - define observed state of cluster
Important: Run "make" to regenerate code after modifying this file

lastTransitionTime.description: LastTransitionTime is the last time the condition changed from one status to another.

lastUpdateTime.description: The last time this condition was updated.

status.description: Status is the status of the condition. One of True, False, Unknown.

type.description: Type is the type of the discovered cluster condition.

exampleYAML:
apiVersion: discovery.open-cluster-management.io/v1
kind: DiscoveredCluster
metadata:
  name: example-discoveredcluster
  namespace: default
spec:
  apiUrl: "example-apiUrl"
  displayName: "example-displayName"
  isManagedCluster: true
  name: "example-name"
  type: "example-type"
